Bug #733

Comment-field-opening “Add one” button is useless/broken/confusing when JavaScript is disabled

Added by Aleksej Serdjukov 11 days ago. Updated 9 days ago.

Status:New Start date:01/08/2012
Priority:Normal Due date:
Assignee:Jef van Schendel % Done:

0%
Category:Programming Spent time: -
Target version:-
Quote

Description

The button (right above the comment field) is intended for users who will have to log in to comment. (<- a wrong understanding of the issue, see below for the right one)

Add

Related issues

Issue #

Delay: days Cancel

History

#1
Updated by Jef van Schendel 11 days ago

Whether you are logged in or logged out, the button is visible.

If you are logged in and click it, the comment form slides out.
If you are logged out and click it, you are sent to the log in page.

At least, this is the expected behavior and as far as I can see also the current behavior on http://www.mediagoblin.com

So, I think everything is OK here, but maybe I did not understand the ticket correctly. The "Add one" button should be visible to user that are logged in.

#2
Updated by Aleksej Serdjukov 11 days ago

Oh, OK. When you have JavaScript disabled, it appears to be just a broken button if you are logged in.

#3
Updated by Jef van Schendel 11 days ago

  • Assignee set to Jef van Schendel

Ah, I see. I didn't try it with JavaScript disabled. I'll assign this to me and fix it some other time. Thanks for reporting!

#4
Updated by Aleksej Serdjukov 9 days ago

  • Subject changed from Comment-adding “Add one” button for logged out users is visible to logged in ones. to Comment-field-opening “Add one” button is useless/broken/confusing when JavaScript is disabled

Updated by Aleksej Serdjukov 9 days ago
